description.narrative: The Vanuatu Kastom Governance Partnership supports strategic partnerships to help augment domestic demand for reform and accountability in the Pacific region. The initiative identifies: fostering community participation in governance; improving access to information through a more effective media; and leadership development as areas to which AusAID can direct support. The Australia Vanuatu Joint Development Cooperation Strategy 2005-2010 focuses on political governance, particularly the objective to improve governance through strengthening the stability and reach of key institutions. The Strategy identifies strengthening partnerships and working with civil society to promote demand-led governance as key means by which to meet this objective. The total value of this initiative is $2.8 million over 4 years, starting 2009-10.
